Welcome to Vision-Aid

Enabling, Educating and Empowering the visually impaired to live with independence and dignity.

Through our network of Vision-Aid resource centers across India and our rich offering of online programs Vision-Aid provides a comprehensive range of devices , training and services which offers holistic vision enhancement and vision rehabilitation programs for adults and children who are blind or who have low vision. Vision-Aid’s innovative programs have won national and international awards and are helping us to bring independence and dignity to over thirty thousand visually impaired each year. Please watch this short video for a quick summary of our work . 

Come join hands with us – your contribution at any level can make a difference – whether it is providing an assistive device or supporting training and education or helping us start a new center, your support is welcome and will help us create a lasting impact!

What's New

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

Continue Reading

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Continue Reading

Six Visually Impaired Candidates Successfully Placed at the Blind Cafe, Chennai

Vision-Aid, in partnership with the NAB India Centre for Blind Women and Disabilities Studies, is pleased to announce the successful placement of six visually impaired candidates at the Blind Café located at TCS Siruseri, Chennai. This achievement marks a significant milestone for the candidates and a proud moment for both organizations committed to advancing inclusive employment.

Continue Reading

Redefining Possibilities – Monika’s Journey

My name is Monika, and this is the story of my life—a journey shaped by love, adversity, resilience, and unwavering hope.

I was born in New Delhi, India, into a family deeply rooted in values and discipline. My father served in the Indian Air Force, while my mother dedicated herself to our home. Growing up with my elder brother, I enjoyed a childhood filled with warmth, laughter, and learning. Although I was an average student, my curiosity and eagerness to explore the world shaped the foundation of who I am today.

Continue Reading

Anshu’s Journey: A New Ray of Hope

In the quiet village of Dhangawan in Madhya Pradesh, 11-year-old Anshu Pratap Singh lived with a challenge no child should face—his world was gradually fading from sight. While other children played freely and kept pace with their studies, Anshu struggled to recognize faces or see everyday objects around him. His father watched helplessly, deeply worried about what the future might hold for his son.

Continue Reading

Empowering Independence Through Accessible Technology

The Inspiring Journey of Mr. Yogendra Singh

This article highlights the remarkable story of Mr. Yogendra Singh, a visually impaired shopkeeper whose life has been transformed through Vision-Aid’s  skill development programs. His journey is a testament to resilience, continuous learning, and the life-changing impact of accessible technology.

Continue Reading

Nidhi Devi – Rising Beyond Limits

Fifteen-year-old Nidhi Devi from Sitapur was born with anophthalmos, a condition that left her without visual development from birth. Yet, despite the challenges she faced, Nidhi’s journey has been defined not by limitations, but by her remarkable determination to learn, grow, and become independent.

Nidhi began her schooling through Braille at a local primary school. While she worked hard, her daily life was filled with difficulties—especially with mobility and navigating unfamiliar spaces. Her turning point came in 2024, when she visited the Vision-Aid Resource center at the Sitapur Eye Hospital, a decision that opened the door to life-changing support.

Continue Reading

Project Chashma

Imagine growing up as a young school-going child, without spectacles or eye care, if you needed it, just because you had no access to eye care.

So grateful that Vision-Aid in partnership with the LV Prasad Eye Institute (LVPEI) is providing comprehensive vision screening, free spectacles, advanced eye care, and rehabilitative support (including CVI) to over 50,000 children in rural and tribal regions of Odisha.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid model showcased in AAO conference in Boston

Vision-Aid showcased India’s leadership in vision rehabilitation at the 2025 American Academy of Optometry Conference in Boston , presenting its scalable and pioneering model for enabling, educating and empowering the visually impaired. The Vision-Aid model was showcased as a poster presentation at the prestigious American Academy of Optometry (AAO) 2025 meeting in Boston by Ms. Devi Udayakumar, Head of Vision Rehabilitation, Vision-Aid India and supported by several US board members including Dr. Aparna Raghuram, Dr. Arathy Kartha, Dr. Arun Kumar and Dr. Ramkumar Ramamirtham.

Continue Reading

Nagajothi’s Journey: From Vision Challenges to Bright Dreams

Meet Ms. Nagajothi, a bright and determined young woman from Virudhunagar district, Tamil Nadu, whose life exemplifies courage, perseverance, and the power of education. Her journey from visual impairment to academic excellence and digital empowerment is truly inspiring.

Continue Reading

Success Spotlight: Harshada Lokhande - From Determined Young Learner to Aspiring Yoga Champion

Harshada Lokhande’s story is a shining example of resilience,determination, and the transformative power of opportunity. A low-vision student from Aurangabad, Harshada joined NFBM Jagriti School for Blind Girls in Class 5. Despite the challenges she faced early on, her dedication and hard work quickly set her apart. Her efforts culminated in a remarkable achievement: securing 2nd position in her SSC Board Exam in March 2025.

Continue Reading

Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli Rolls Out First Community-Based Low Vision Initiative

The resource center at Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli has launched its first community-based low vision program, reaching five vision centers in and around the region of Tirunelveli.

Continue Reading

Anil Kumar – A Journey of Hope and Learning

I am Anil Kumar, a person with vision impairment and a strong belief in hope. I dream of becoming a professor and researcher, driven by my curiosity and love for learning. I enjoy music, coding, finance, politics, and economics.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Showcases Innovation in Assistive Technology at EMPOWER 2025 and AAO 2025

The Vision-Aid team participated at EMPOWER 2025, India’s flagship assistive-technology conference at IIT Delhi (Oct 3–5), presenting two sessions and hosting a booth. And next week, we are really excited about Vision-Aid’ unique service model getting the spotlight in the American Academy of Optometry (AAO) in Boston on Oct 9th, with around 7,000 professionals expected to attend AAO this year.
Continue Reading

Last Quarter at a Glance: Transforming Lives Across India

Across 75 locations, Vision-Aid teams are working tirelessly to empower individuals with visual impairments, helping them live with greater independence and dignity. This quarter, we reached nearly 6,000 children and adults through more than 11,000 sessions and interventions. We are delighted to share some of the inspiring stories and milestones that made this period truly special. Here’s a snapshot of the impactful initiatives we carried out.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid USA Earns Rare 100/100 Score and 4-Star Rating from Charity Navigator

As of 2025, Charity Navigator has rated and listed more than 225,000 charitable organizations across the United States. Fewer than 2% of these have achieved the distinction of earning a perfect 100/100 score alongside the highest possible 4-Star rating. Vision-Aid USA, a Lexington, Massachusetts–based nonprofit serving the visually impaired, is proud to join this elite group after receiving this rare honor this week.

Continue Reading

New England’s best summer show is just days away now! Are you ready?

This year’s show,“Shakuntala – The Legend of the Lost Ring” – a Broadway style musical – is on Sunday July 27th from 4 pm, in Collins Theater in N. Andover, MA.

New England’s best dance talent is hard at work to forge an unforgettable show for you!

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Vision-Aid Celebrates the First Batch of BPO Training Placements at Chennai

Vision-Aid has successfully completed the first batch of BPO training course at the Advanced Training Center in Chennai. The program, launched in February 2025, was designed to empower visually impaired students with computer, communication, and professional skills to help them find meaningful employment. We are proud to introduce our first batch of candidates, who have now secured jobs in reputed organizations with Vision-Aid’s support.

Continue Reading

From Challenges to Tech Success: Mohan Raj’s Journey with Vision-Aid

Mohan hails from Salem, Tamil Nadu. Born with only 40% vision, he faced significant challenges in his early education. Despite these obstacles, he completed his schooling in a mainstream school in 2013. Reading from the blackboard and printed books was particularly difficult for him, but with the support of his friends and teachers—who helped him with notes—Mohan persevered and continued his studies.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Celebrates the Successful Completion of Its 10th Batch of Digital Accessibility Testing Training

Vision-Aid, with the valued support of BarrierBreak, proudly announces the successful completion of its 10th batch of the Digital Accessibility Testing (DAT) Training Program. We sincerely thank BarrierBreak for their unwavering partnership in empowering our students and enabling this milestone. The batch commenced in March 2025 and concluded in July 2025, with 21 students graduating from the program.

Continue Reading

A Visionary Beyond Sight: The Inspiring Journey of Vedant Mundada

Vedant Mundada’s journey is not just about facing life’s challenges. It is about turning them into purpose. When he lost his eyesight at just one and a half years old due to optic nerve damage, many would expect limitations to follow. But Vedant’s life tells a different story — one filled with courage, growth, and inspiration.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Announces its New Leadership Team for 2025-26

LEXINGTON, MA – Vision-Aid, a non-profit organization serving the visually impaired, announced several notable additions to its leadership team for 2025-26. This year’s 100% volunteer Vision-Aid Leadership team includes its 15-member Board of Directors (BOD), 15-member Board of Advisors (BOA), and 5-member Council of Ambassadors (COA).

Continue Reading

Empowering Futures: Vision-Aid’s Support Leads Jagriti SDC Students to 100% Success in HSC Board Exams

Since 2022, Vision-Aid has been a dedicated partner to Jagriti Skill Development Center (SDC), offering transformative training programs such as communication skills, computer literacy, and personality development to visually impaired students. Today, we are proud to celebrate a remarkable milestone: all 12 students from Jagriti SDC who appeared for the HSC Board Exams (FY2025) have successfully passed — marking the 4th consecutive year of 100% results for the center.

Continue Reading

Highlights from the last quarter

In the last quarter, our Vision-Aid Resource Centers throughout India have been dedicated to supporting the visually impaired community. We are excited to report that we have assisted over 6400 children and adults across approximately 50 locations, conducting more than 8000 sessions and interventions. Below is a glimpse of some of the meaningful work we've accomplished in this period

Continue Reading

Journey of Resilience and Empowerment: Mohan Ram’s Story

My name is Mohan Ram, and I hail from Bengaluru, Karnataka. After completing my schooling in 2006, I pursued a Diploma in Electronics & Communication. However, I soon began facing difficulties with practical lab work, assignments, and a noticeable deterioration in my night vision. A visit to the ophthalmologist confirmed the diagnosis: Retinitis Pigmentosa, a progressive eye disorder that leads to gradual vision loss.

Continue Reading

Welcome to Vision-Aid

Enabling, Educating and Empowering the visually impaired to live with independence and dignity.

Through our network of Vision-Aid resource centers across India and our rich offering of online programs Vision-Aid provides a comprehensive range of devices , training and services which offers holistic vision enhancement and vision rehabilitation programs for adults and children who are blind or who have low vision. Vision-Aid’s innovative programs have won national and international awards and are helping us to bring independence and dignity to over thirty thousand visually impaired each year. Please watch this short video for a quick summary of our work . 

Come join hands with us – your contribution at any level can make a difference – whether it is providing an assistive device or supporting training and education or helping us start a new center, your support is welcome and will help us create a lasting impact!

What's New

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

Continue Reading

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Continue Reading

Six Visually Impaired Candidates Successfully Placed at the Blind Cafe, Chennai

Vision-Aid, in partnership with the NAB India Centre for Blind Women and Disabilities Studies, is pleased to announce the successful placement of six visually impaired candidates at the Blind Café located at TCS Siruseri, Chennai. This achievement marks a significant milestone for the candidates and a proud moment for both organizations committed to advancing inclusive employment.

Continue Reading

Redefining Possibilities – Monika’s Journey

My name is Monika, and this is the story of my life—a journey shaped by love, adversity, resilience, and unwavering hope.

I was born in New Delhi, India, into a family deeply rooted in values and discipline. My father served in the Indian Air Force, while my mother dedicated herself to our home. Growing up with my elder brother, I enjoyed a childhood filled with warmth, laughter, and learning. Although I was an average student, my curiosity and eagerness to explore the world shaped the foundation of who I am today.

Continue Reading

Anshu’s Journey: A New Ray of Hope

In the quiet village of Dhangawan in Madhya Pradesh, 11-year-old Anshu Pratap Singh lived with a challenge no child should face—his world was gradually fading from sight. While other children played freely and kept pace with their studies, Anshu struggled to recognize faces or see everyday objects around him. His father watched helplessly, deeply worried about what the future might hold for his son.

Continue Reading

Empowering Independence Through Accessible Technology

The Inspiring Journey of Mr. Yogendra Singh

This article highlights the remarkable story of Mr. Yogendra Singh, a visually impaired shopkeeper whose life has been transformed through Vision-Aid’s  skill development programs. His journey is a testament to resilience, continuous learning, and the life-changing impact of accessible technology.

Continue Reading

Nidhi Devi – Rising Beyond Limits

Fifteen-year-old Nidhi Devi from Sitapur was born with anophthalmos, a condition that left her without visual development from birth. Yet, despite the challenges she faced, Nidhi’s journey has been defined not by limitations, but by her remarkable determination to learn, grow, and become independent.

Nidhi began her schooling through Braille at a local primary school. While she worked hard, her daily life was filled with difficulties—especially with mobility and navigating unfamiliar spaces. Her turning point came in 2024, when she visited the Vision-Aid Resource center at the Sitapur Eye Hospital, a decision that opened the door to life-changing support.

Continue Reading

Project Chashma

Imagine growing up as a young school-going child, without spectacles or eye care, if you needed it, just because you had no access to eye care.

So grateful that Vision-Aid in partnership with the LV Prasad Eye Institute (LVPEI) is providing comprehensive vision screening, free spectacles, advanced eye care, and rehabilitative support (including CVI) to over 50,000 children in rural and tribal regions of Odisha.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid model showcased in AAO conference in Boston

Vision-Aid showcased India’s leadership in vision rehabilitation at the 2025 American Academy of Optometry Conference in Boston , presenting its scalable and pioneering model for enabling, educating and empowering the visually impaired. The Vision-Aid model was showcased as a poster presentation at the prestigious American Academy of Optometry (AAO) 2025 meeting in Boston by Ms. Devi Udayakumar, Head of Vision Rehabilitation, Vision-Aid India and supported by several US board members including Dr. Aparna Raghuram, Dr. Arathy Kartha, Dr. Arun Kumar and Dr. Ramkumar Ramamirtham.

Continue Reading

Nagajothi’s Journey: From Vision Challenges to Bright Dreams

Meet Ms. Nagajothi, a bright and determined young woman from Virudhunagar district, Tamil Nadu, whose life exemplifies courage, perseverance, and the power of education. Her journey from visual impairment to academic excellence and digital empowerment is truly inspiring.

Continue Reading

Success Spotlight: Harshada Lokhande - From Determined Young Learner to Aspiring Yoga Champion

Harshada Lokhande’s story is a shining example of resilience,determination, and the transformative power of opportunity. A low-vision student from Aurangabad, Harshada joined NFBM Jagriti School for Blind Girls in Class 5. Despite the challenges she faced early on, her dedication and hard work quickly set her apart. Her efforts culminated in a remarkable achievement: securing 2nd position in her SSC Board Exam in March 2025.

Continue Reading

Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli Rolls Out First Community-Based Low Vision Initiative

The resource center at Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli has launched its first community-based low vision program, reaching five vision centers in and around the region of Tirunelveli.

Continue Reading

Anil Kumar – A Journey of Hope and Learning

I am Anil Kumar, a person with vision impairment and a strong belief in hope. I dream of becoming a professor and researcher, driven by my curiosity and love for learning. I enjoy music, coding, finance, politics, and economics.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Showcases Innovation in Assistive Technology at EMPOWER 2025 and AAO 2025

The Vision-Aid team participated at EMPOWER 2025, India’s flagship assistive-technology conference at IIT Delhi (Oct 3–5), presenting two sessions and hosting a booth. And next week, we are really excited about Vision-Aid’ unique service model getting the spotlight in the American Academy of Optometry (AAO) in Boston on Oct 9th, with around 7,000 professionals expected to attend AAO this year.
Continue Reading

Last Quarter at a Glance: Transforming Lives Across India

Across 75 locations, Vision-Aid teams are working tirelessly to empower individuals with visual impairments, helping them live with greater independence and dignity. This quarter, we reached nearly 6,000 children and adults through more than 11,000 sessions and interventions. We are delighted to share some of the inspiring stories and milestones that made this period truly special. Here’s a snapshot of the impactful initiatives we carried out.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid USA Earns Rare 100/100 Score and 4-Star Rating from Charity Navigator

As of 2025, Charity Navigator has rated and listed more than 225,000 charitable organizations across the United States. Fewer than 2% of these have achieved the distinction of earning a perfect 100/100 score alongside the highest possible 4-Star rating. Vision-Aid USA, a Lexington, Massachusetts–based nonprofit serving the visually impaired, is proud to join this elite group after receiving this rare honor this week.

Continue Reading

This year’s show,“Shakuntala – The Legend of the Lost Ring” – a Broadway style musical – is on Sunday July 27th from 4 pm, in Collins Theater in N. Andover, MA.

New England’s best dance talent is hard at work to forge an unforgettable show for you!

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Vision-Aid Celebrates the First Batch of BPO Training Placements at Chennai

Vision-Aid has successfully completed the first batch of BPO training course at the Advanced Training Center in Chennai. The program, launched in February 2025, was designed to empower visually impaired students with computer, communication, and professional skills to help them find meaningful employment. We are proud to introduce our first batch of candidates, who have now secured jobs in reputed organizations with Vision-Aid’s support.

Continue Reading

From Challenges to Tech Success: Mohan Raj’s Journey with Vision-Aid

Mohan hails from Salem, Tamil Nadu. Born with only 40% vision, he faced significant challenges in his early education. Despite these obstacles, he completed his schooling in a mainstream school in 2013. Reading from the blackboard and printed books was particularly difficult for him, but with the support of his friends and teachers—who helped him with notes—Mohan persevered and continued his studies.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Celebrates the Successful Completion of Its 10th Batch of Digital Accessibility Testing Training

Vision-Aid, with the valued support of BarrierBreak, proudly announces the successful completion of its 10th batch of the Digital Accessibility Testing (DAT) Training Program. We sincerely thank BarrierBreak for their unwavering partnership in empowering our students and enabling this milestone. The batch commenced in March 2025 and concluded in July 2025, with 21 students graduating from the program.

Continue Reading

A Visionary Beyond Sight: The Inspiring Journey of Vedant Mundada

Vedant Mundada’s journey is not just about facing life’s challenges. It is about turning them into purpose. When he lost his eyesight at just one and a half years old due to optic nerve damage, many would expect limitations to follow. But Vedant’s life tells a different story — one filled with courage, growth, and inspiration.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Announces its New Leadership Team for 2025-26

LEXINGTON, MA – Vision-Aid, a non-profit organization serving the visually impaired, announced several notable additions to its leadership team for 2025-26. This year’s 100% volunteer Vision-Aid Leadership team includes its 15-member Board of Directors (BOD), 15-member Board of Advisors (BOA), and 5-member Council of Ambassadors (COA).

Continue Reading

Empowering Futures: Vision-Aid’s Support Leads Jagriti SDC Students to 100% Success in HSC Board Exams

Since 2022, Vision-Aid has been a dedicated partner to Jagriti Skill Development Center (SDC), offering transformative training programs such as communication skills, computer literacy, and personality development to visually impaired students. Today, we are proud to celebrate a remarkable milestone: all 12 students from Jagriti SDC who appeared for the HSC Board Exams (FY2025) have successfully passed — marking the 4th consecutive year of 100% results for the center.

Continue Reading

Highlights from the last quarter

In the last quarter, our Vision-Aid Resource Centers throughout India have been dedicated to supporting the visually impaired community. We are excited to report that we have assisted over 6400 children and adults across approximately 50 locations, conducting more than 8000 sessions and interventions. Below is a glimpse of some of the meaningful work we've accomplished in this period

Journey of Resilience and Empowerment: Mohan Ram’s Story

My name is Mohan Ram, and I hail from Bengaluru, Karnataka. After completing my schooling in 2006, I pursued a Diploma in Electronics & Communication. However, I soon began facing difficulties with practical lab work, assignments, and a noticeable deterioration in my night vision. A visit to the ophthalmologist confirmed the diagnosis: Retinitis Pigmentosa, a progressive eye disorder that leads to gradual vision loss.

Welcome to Vision-Aid

Enabling, Educating and Empowering the visually impaired to live with independence and dignity.

Through our network of Vision-Aid resource centers across India and our rich offering of online programs Vision-Aid provides a comprehensive range of devices , training and services which offers holistic vision enhancement and vision rehabilitation programs for adults and children who are blind or who have low vision. Vision-Aid’s innovative programs have won national and international awards and are helping us to bring independence and dignity to over thirty thousand visually impaired each year. Please watch this short video for a quick summary of our work . 

Come join hands with us – your contribution at any level can make a difference – whether it is providing an assistive device or supporting training and education or helping us start a new center, your support is welcome and will help us create a lasting impact!

What's New

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

Continue Reading

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Continue Reading

Six Visually Impaired Candidates Successfully Placed at the Blind Cafe, Chennai

Vision-Aid, in partnership with the NAB India Centre for Blind Women and Disabilities Studies, is pleased to announce the successful placement of six visually impaired candidates at the Blind Café located at TCS Siruseri, Chennai. This achievement marks a significant milestone for the candidates and a proud moment for both organizations committed to advancing inclusive employment.

Continue Reading

Redefining Possibilities – Monika’s Journey

My name is Monika, and this is the story of my life—a journey shaped by love, adversity, resilience, and unwavering hope.

I was born in New Delhi, India, into a family deeply rooted in values and discipline. My father served in the Indian Air Force, while my mother dedicated herself to our home. Growing up with my elder brother, I enjoyed a childhood filled with warmth, laughter, and learning. Although I was an average student, my curiosity and eagerness to explore the world shaped the foundation of who I am today.

Continue Reading

Anshu’s Journey: A New Ray of Hope

In the quiet village of Dhangawan in Madhya Pradesh, 11-year-old Anshu Pratap Singh lived with a challenge no child should face—his world was gradually fading from sight. While other children played freely and kept pace with their studies, Anshu struggled to recognize faces or see everyday objects around him. His father watched helplessly, deeply worried about what the future might hold for his son.

Continue Reading

Empowering Independence Through Accessible Technology

The Inspiring Journey of Mr. Yogendra Singh

This article highlights the remarkable story of Mr. Yogendra Singh, a visually impaired shopkeeper whose life has been transformed through Vision-Aid’s  skill development programs. His journey is a testament to resilience, continuous learning, and the life-changing impact of accessible technology.

Continue Reading

Nidhi Devi – Rising Beyond Limits

Fifteen-year-old Nidhi Devi from Sitapur was born with anophthalmos, a condition that left her without visual development from birth. Yet, despite the challenges she faced, Nidhi’s journey has been defined not by limitations, but by her remarkable determination to learn, grow, and become independent.

Nidhi began her schooling through Braille at a local primary school. While she worked hard, her daily life was filled with difficulties—especially with mobility and navigating unfamiliar spaces. Her turning point came in 2024, when she visited the Vision-Aid Resource center at the Sitapur Eye Hospital, a decision that opened the door to life-changing support.

Continue Reading

Project Chashma

Imagine growing up as a young school-going child, without spectacles or eye care, if you needed it, just because you had no access to eye care.

So grateful that Vision-Aid in partnership with the LV Prasad Eye Institute (LVPEI) is providing comprehensive vision screening, free spectacles, advanced eye care, and rehabilitative support (including CVI) to over 50,000 children in rural and tribal regions of Odisha.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid model showcased in AAO conference in Boston

Vision-Aid showcased India’s leadership in vision rehabilitation at the 2025 American Academy of Optometry Conference in Boston , presenting its scalable and pioneering model for enabling, educating and empowering the visually impaired. The Vision-Aid model was showcased as a poster presentation at the prestigious American Academy of Optometry (AAO) 2025 meeting in Boston by Ms. Devi Udayakumar, Head of Vision Rehabilitation, Vision-Aid India and supported by several US board members including Dr. Aparna Raghuram, Dr. Arathy Kartha, Dr. Arun Kumar and Dr. Ramkumar Ramamirtham.

Continue Reading

Nagajothi’s Journey: From Vision Challenges to Bright Dreams

Meet Ms. Nagajothi, a bright and determined young woman from Virudhunagar district, Tamil Nadu, whose life exemplifies courage, perseverance, and the power of education. Her journey from visual impairment to academic excellence and digital empowerment is truly inspiring.

Continue Reading

Success Spotlight: Harshada Lokhande - From Determined Young Learner to Aspiring Yoga Champion

Harshada Lokhande’s story is a shining example of resilience,determination, and the transformative power of opportunity. A low-vision student from Aurangabad, Harshada joined NFBM Jagriti School for Blind Girls in Class 5. Despite the challenges she faced early on, her dedication and hard work quickly set her apart. Her efforts culminated in a remarkable achievement: securing 2nd position in her SSC Board Exam in March 2025.

Continue Reading

Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli Rolls Out First Community-Based Low Vision Initiative

The resource center at Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli has launched its first community-based low vision program, reaching five vision centers in and around the region of Tirunelveli.

Continue Reading

Anil Kumar – A Journey of Hope and Learning

I am Anil Kumar, a person with vision impairment and a strong belief in hope. I dream of becoming a professor and researcher, driven by my curiosity and love for learning. I enjoy music, coding, finance, politics, and economics.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Showcases Innovation in Assistive Technology at EMPOWER 2025 and AAO 2025

The Vision-Aid team participated at EMPOWER 2025, India’s flagship assistive-technology conference at IIT Delhi (Oct 3–5), presenting two sessions and hosting a booth. And next week, we are really excited about Vision-Aid’ unique service model getting the spotlight in the American Academy of Optometry (AAO) in Boston on Oct 9th, with around 7,000 professionals expected to attend AAO this year.
Continue Reading

Last Quarter at a Glance: Transforming Lives Across India

Across 75 locations, Vision-Aid teams are working tirelessly to empower individuals with visual impairments, helping them live with greater independence and dignity. This quarter, we reached nearly 6,000 children and adults through more than 11,000 sessions and interventions. We are delighted to share some of the inspiring stories and milestones that made this period truly special. Here’s a snapshot of the impactful initiatives we carried out.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid USA Earns Rare 100/100 Score and 4-Star Rating from Charity Navigator

As of 2025, Charity Navigator has rated and listed more than 225,000 charitable organizations across the United States. Fewer than 2% of these have achieved the distinction of earning a perfect 100/100 score alongside the highest possible 4-Star rating. Vision-Aid USA, a Lexington, Massachusetts–based nonprofit serving the visually impaired, is proud to join this elite group after receiving this rare honor this week.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Update July 2025

Dear Friend,

New England’s best summer show is just days away now! Are you ready?

This year’s show,“Shakuntala – The Legend of the Lost Ring” – a Broadway style musical – is on Sunday July 27th from 4 pm, in Collins Theater in N. Andover, MA.

New England’s best dance talent is hard at work to forge an unforgettable show for you!

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Vision-Aid Celebrates the First Batch of BPO Training Placements at Chennai

Vision-Aid has successfully completed the first batch of BPO training course at the Advanced Training Center in Chennai. The program, launched in February 2025, was designed to empower visually impaired students with computer, communication, and professional skills to help them find meaningful employment. We are proud to introduce our first batch of candidates, who have now secured jobs in reputed organizations with Vision-Aid’s support.

Continue Reading

From Challenges to Tech Success: Mohan Raj’s Journey with Vision-Aid

Mohan hails from Salem, Tamil Nadu. Born with only 40% vision, he faced significant challenges in his early education. Despite these obstacles, he completed his schooling in a mainstream school in 2013. Reading from the blackboard and printed books was particularly difficult for him, but with the support of his friends and teachers—who helped him with notes—Mohan persevered and continued his studies.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Celebrates the Successful Completion of Its 10th Batch of Digital Accessibility Testing Training

Vision-Aid, with the valued support of BarrierBreak, proudly announces the successful completion of its 10th batch of the Digital Accessibility Testing (DAT) Training Program. We sincerely thank BarrierBreak for their unwavering partnership in empowering our students and enabling this milestone. The batch commenced in March 2025 and concluded in July 2025, with 21 students graduating from the program.

Continue Reading

A Visionary Beyond Sight: The Inspiring Journey of Vedant Mundada

Vedant Mundada’s journey is not just about facing life’s challenges. It is about turning them into purpose. When he lost his eyesight at just one and a half years old due to optic nerve damage, many would expect limitations to follow. But Vedant’s life tells a different story — one filled with courage, growth, and inspiration.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Announces its New Leadership Team for 2025-26

LEXINGTON, MA – Vision-Aid, a non-profit organization serving the visually impaired, announced several notable additions to its leadership team for 2025-26. This year’s 100% volunteer Vision-Aid Leadership team includes its 15-member Board of Directors (BOD), 15-member Board of Advisors (BOA), and 5-member Council of Ambassadors (COA).

Continue Reading

Empowering Futures: Vision-Aid’s Support Leads Jagriti SDC Students to 100% Success in HSC Board Exams

Since 2022, Vision-Aid has been a dedicated partner to Jagriti Skill Development Center (SDC), offering transformative training programs such as communication skills, computer literacy, and personality development to visually impaired students. Today, we are proud to celebrate a remarkable milestone: all 12 students from Jagriti SDC who appeared for the HSC Board Exams (FY2025) have successfully passed — marking the 4th consecutive year of 100% results for the center.

Continue Reading

In the last quarter, our Vision-Aid Resource Centers throughout India have been dedicated to supporting the visually impaired community. We are excited to report that we have assisted over 6400 children and adults across approximately 50 locations, conducting more than 8000 sessions and interventions. Journey of Resilience and Empowerment: Mohan Ram’s Story

My name is Mohan Ram, and I hail from Bengaluru, Karnataka. After completing my schooling in 2006, I pursued a Diploma in Electronics & Communication. However, I soon began facing difficulties with practical lab work, assignments, and a noticeable deterioration in my night vision. A visit to the ophthalmologist confirmed the diagnosis: Retinitis Pigmentosa, a progressive eye disorder that leads to gradual vision loss.

Welcome to Vision-Aid

Enabling, Educating and Empowering the visually impaired to live with independence and dignity.

Through our network of Vision-Aid resource centers across India and our rich offering of online programs Vision-Aid provides a comprehensive range of devices , training and services which offers holistic vision enhancement and vision rehabilitation programs for adults and children who are blind or who have low vision. Vision-Aid’s innovative programs have won national and international awards and are helping us to bring independence and dignity to over thirty thousand visually impaired each year. Please watch this short video for a quick summary of our work . 

Come join hands with us – your contribution at any level can make a difference – whether it is providing an assistive device or supporting training and education or helping us start a new center, your support is welcome and will help us create a lasting impact!

What's New

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

Continue Reading

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Continue Reading

Six Visually Impaired Candidates Successfully Placed at the Blind Cafe, Chennai

Vision-Aid, in partnership with the NAB India Centre for Blind Women and Disabilities Studies, is pleased to announce the successful placement of six visually impaired candidates at the Blind Café located at TCS Siruseri, Chennai. This achievement marks a significant milestone for the candidates and a proud moment for both organizations committed to advancing inclusive employment.

Continue Reading

Redefining Possibilities – Monika’s Journey

My name is Monika, and this is the story of my life—a journey shaped by love, adversity, resilience, and unwavering hope.

I was born in New Delhi, India, into a family deeply rooted in values and discipline. My father served in the Indian Air Force, while my mother dedicated herself to our home. Growing up with my elder brother, I enjoyed a childhood filled with warmth, laughter, and learning. Although I was an average student, my curiosity and eagerness to explore the world shaped the foundation of who I am today.

Continue Reading

Anshu’s Journey: A New Ray of Hope

In the quiet village of Dhangawan in Madhya Pradesh, 11-year-old Anshu Pratap Singh lived with a challenge no child should face—his world was gradually fading from sight. While other children played freely and kept pace with their studies, Anshu struggled to recognize faces or see everyday objects around him. His father watched helplessly, deeply worried about what the future might hold for his son.

Continue Reading

Empowering Independence Through Accessible Technology

The Inspiring Journey of Mr. Yogendra Singh

This article highlights the remarkable story of Mr. Yogendra Singh, a visually impaired shopkeeper whose life has been transformed through Vision-Aid’s  skill development programs. His journey is a testament to resilience, continuous learning, and the life-changing impact of accessible technology.

Continue Reading

Nidhi Devi – Rising Beyond Limits

Fifteen-year-old Nidhi Devi from Sitapur was born with anophthalmos, a condition that left her without visual development from birth. Yet, despite the challenges she faced, Nidhi’s journey has been defined not by limitations, but by her remarkable determination to learn, grow, and become independent.

Nidhi began her schooling through Braille at a local primary school. While she worked hard, her daily life was filled with difficulties—especially with mobility and navigating unfamiliar spaces. Her turning point came in 2024, when she visited the Vision-Aid Resource center at the Sitapur Eye Hospital, a decision that opened the door to life-changing support.

Continue Reading

Project Chashma

Imagine growing up as a young school-going child, without spectacles or eye care, if you needed it, just because you had no access to eye care.

So grateful that Vision-Aid in partnership with the LV Prasad Eye Institute (LVPEI) is providing comprehensive vision screening, free spectacles, advanced eye care, and rehabilitative support (including CVI) to over 50,000 children in rural and tribal regions of Odisha.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid model showcased in AAO conference in Boston

Vision-Aid showcased India’s leadership in vision rehabilitation at the 2025 American Academy of Optometry Conference in Boston , presenting its scalable and pioneering model for enabling, educating and empowering the visually impaired. The Vision-Aid model was showcased as a poster presentation at the prestigious American Academy of Optometry (AAO) 2025 meeting in Boston by Ms. Devi Udayakumar, Head of Vision Rehabilitation, Vision-Aid India and supported by several US board members including Dr. Aparna Raghuram, Dr. Arathy Kartha, Dr. Arun Kumar and Dr. Ramkumar Ramamirtham.

Continue Reading

Nagajothi’s Journey: From Vision Challenges to Bright Dreams

Meet Ms. Nagajothi, a bright and determined young woman from Virudhunagar district, Tamil Nadu, whose life exemplifies courage, perseverance, and the power of education. Her journey from visual impairment to academic excellence and digital empowerment is truly inspiring.

Continue Reading

Success Spotlight: Harshada Lokhande - From Determined Young Learner to Aspiring Yoga Champion

Harshada Lokhande’s story is a shining example of resilience,determination, and the transformative power of opportunity. A low-vision student from Aurangabad, Harshada joined NFBM Jagriti School for Blind Girls in Class 5. Despite the challenges she faced early on, her dedication and hard work quickly set her apart. Her efforts culminated in a remarkable achievement: securing 2nd position in her SSC Board Exam in March 2025.

Continue Reading

Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli Rolls Out First Community-Based Low Vision Initiative

The resource center at Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli has launched its first community-based low vision program, reaching five vision centers in and around the region of Tirunelveli.

Continue Reading

Anil Kumar – A Journey of Hope and Learning

I am Anil Kumar, a person with vision impairment and a strong belief in hope. I dream of becoming a professor and researcher, driven by my curiosity and love for learning. I enjoy music, coding, finance, politics, and economics.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Showcases Innovation in Assistive Technology at EMPOWER 2025 and AAO 2025

The Vision-Aid team participated at EMPOWER 2025, India’s flagship assistive-technology conference at IIT Delhi (Oct 3–5), presenting two sessions and hosting a booth. And next week, we are really excited about Vision-Aid’ unique service model getting the spotlight in the American Academy of Optometry (AAO) in Boston on Oct 9th, with around 7,000 professionals expected to attend AAO this year.
Continue Reading

Last Quarter at a Glance: Transforming Lives Across India

Across 75 locations, Vision-Aid teams are working tirelessly to empower individuals with visual impairments, helping them live with greater independence and dignity. This quarter, we reached nearly 6,000 children and adults through more than 11,000 sessions and interventions. We are delighted to share some of the inspiring stories and milestones that made this period truly special. Here’s a snapshot of the impactful initiatives we carried out.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid USA Earns Rare 100/100 Score and 4-Star Rating from Charity Navigator

As of 2025, Charity Navigator has rated and listed more than 225,000 charitable organizations across the United States. Fewer than 2% of these have achieved the distinction of earning a perfect 100/100 score alongside the highest possible 4-Star rating. Vision-Aid USA, a Lexington, Massachusetts–based nonprofit serving the visually impaired, is proud to join this elite group after receiving this rare honor this week.

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Welcome to Vision-Aid

Enabling, Educating and Empowering the visually impaired to live with independence and dignity.

Through our network of Vision-Aid resource centers across India and our rich offering of online programs Vision-Aid provides a comprehensive range of devices , training and services which offers holistic vision enhancement and vision rehabilitation programs for adults and children who are blind or who have low vision. Vision-Aid’s innovative programs have won national and international awards and are helping us to bring independence and dignity to over thirty thousand visually impaired each year. Please watch this short video for a quick summary of our work . 

Come join hands with us – your contribution at any level can make a difference – whether it is providing an assistive device or supporting training and education or helping us start a new center, your support is welcome and will help us create a lasting impact!

What's New

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

Continue Reading

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Continue Reading

Six Visually Impaired Candidates Successfully Placed at the Blind Cafe, Chennai

Vision-Aid, in partnership with the NAB India Centre for Blind Women and Disabilities Studies, is pleased to announce the successful placement of six visually impaired candidates at the Blind Café located at TCS Siruseri, Chennai. This achievement marks a significant milestone for the candidates and a proud moment for both organizations committed to advancing inclusive employment.

Continue Reading

Redefining Possibilities – Monika’s Journey

My name is Monika, and this is the story of my life—a journey shaped by love, adversity, resilience, and unwavering hope.

I was born in New Delhi, India, into a family deeply rooted in values and discipline. My father served in the Indian Air Force, while my mother dedicated herself to our home. Growing up with my elder brother, I enjoyed a childhood filled with warmth, laughter, and learning. Although I was an average student, my curiosity and eagerness to explore the world shaped the foundation of who I am today.

Continue Reading

Anshu’s Journey: A New Ray of Hope

In the quiet village of Dhangawan in Madhya Pradesh, 11-year-old Anshu Pratap Singh lived with a challenge no child should face—his world was gradually fading from sight. While other children played freely and kept pace with their studies, Anshu struggled to recognize faces or see everyday objects around him. His father watched helplessly, deeply worried about what the future might hold for his son.

Continue Reading

Empowering Independence Through Accessible Technology

The Inspiring Journey of Mr. Yogendra Singh

This article highlights the remarkable story of Mr. Yogendra Singh, a visually impaired shopkeeper whose life has been transformed through Vision-Aid’s  skill development programs. His journey is a testament to resilience, continuous learning, and the life-changing impact of accessible technology.

Continue Reading

Nidhi Devi – Rising Beyond Limits

Fifteen-year-old Nidhi Devi from Sitapur was born with anophthalmos, a condition that left her without visual development from birth. Yet, despite the challenges she faced, Nidhi’s journey has been defined not by limitations, but by her remarkable determination to learn, grow, and become independent.

Nidhi began her schooling through Braille at a local primary school. While she worked hard, her daily life was filled with difficulties—especially with mobility and navigating unfamiliar spaces. Her turning point came in 2024, when she visited the Vision-Aid Resource center at the Sitapur Eye Hospital, a decision that opened the door to life-changing support.

Continue Reading

Project Chashma

Imagine growing up as a young school-going child, without spectacles or eye care, if you needed it, just because you had no access to eye care.

So grateful that Vision-Aid in partnership with the LV Prasad Eye Institute (LVPEI) is providing comprehensive vision screening, free spectacles, advanced eye care, and rehabilitative support (including CVI) to over 50,000 children in rural and tribal regions of Odisha.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid model showcased in AAO conference in Boston

Vision-Aid showcased India’s leadership in vision rehabilitation at the 2025 American Academy of Optometry Conference in Boston , presenting its scalable and pioneering model for enabling, educating and empowering the visually impaired. The Vision-Aid model was showcased as a poster presentation at the prestigious American Academy of Optometry (AAO) 2025 meeting in Boston by Ms. Devi Udayakumar, Head of Vision Rehabilitation, Vision-Aid India and supported by several US board members including Dr. Aparna Raghuram, Dr. Arathy Kartha, Dr. Arun Kumar and Dr. Ramkumar Ramamirtham.

Continue Reading

Nagajothi’s Journey: From Vision Challenges to Bright Dreams

Meet Ms. Nagajothi, a bright and determined young woman from Virudhunagar district, Tamil Nadu, whose life exemplifies courage, perseverance, and the power of education. Her journey from visual impairment to academic excellence and digital empowerment is truly inspiring.

Continue Reading

Success Spotlight: Harshada Lokhande - From Determined Young Learner to Aspiring Yoga Champion

Harshada Lokhande’s story is a shining example of resilience,determination, and the transformative power of opportunity. A low-vision student from Aurangabad, Harshada joined NFBM Jagriti School for Blind Girls in Class 5. Despite the challenges she faced early on, her dedication and hard work quickly set her apart. Her efforts culminated in a remarkable achievement: securing 2nd position in her SSC Board Exam in March 2025.

Continue Reading

Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli Rolls Out First Community-Based Low Vision Initiative

The resource center at Aravind Eye Hospital – Tirunelveli has launched its first community-based low vision program, reaching five vision centers in and around the region of Tirunelveli.

Continue Reading

Anil Kumar – A Journey of Hope and Learning

I am Anil Kumar, a person with vision impairment and a strong belief in hope. I dream of becoming a professor and researcher, driven by my curiosity and love for learning. I enjoy music, coding, finance, politics, and economics.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Showcases Innovation in Assistive Technology at EMPOWER 2025 and AAO 2025

The Vision-Aid team participated at EMPOWER 2025, India’s flagship assistive-technology conference at IIT Delhi (Oct 3–5), presenting two sessions and hosting a booth. And next week, we are really excited about Vision-Aid’ unique service model getting the spotlight in the American Academy of Optometry (AAO) in Boston on Oct 9th, with around 7,000 professionals expected to attend AAO this year.
Continue Reading

Last Quarter at a Glance: Transforming Lives Across India

Across 75 locations, Vision-Aid teams are working tirelessly to empower individuals with visual impairments, helping them live with greater independence and dignity. This quarter, we reached nearly 6,000 children and adults through more than 11,000 sessions and interventions. We are delighted to share some of the inspiring stories and milestones that made this period truly special. Here’s a snapshot of the impactful initiatives we carried out.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid USA Earns Rare 100/100 Score and 4-Star Rating from Charity Navigator

As of 2025, Charity Navigator has rated and listed more than 225,000 charitable organizations across the United States. Fewer than 2% of these have achieved the distinction of earning a perfect 100/100 score alongside the highest possible 4-Star rating. Vision-Aid USA, a Lexington, Massachusetts–based nonprofit serving the visually impaired, is proud to join this elite group after receiving this rare honor this week.

Highlights from the last quarter

Vision-Aid teams across 75 locations in India continued their dedicated efforts to support people with visual impairment, helping them lead lives of independence and dignity. Through more than 7000 sessions and interventions, we reached serving nearly 5400 beneficiaries with visual impairment and through project CHASHMA nearly 10,470 children got benefitted and we are pleased to share some of the inspiring stories and key milestones that made this quarter especially meaningful. Below is a snapshot of select initiatives that created lasting impact during this period.

A Journey of Resilience and Hope: Farhan’s Success Story

In 2022, Mast. Muhamad Farhan from Bangladesh completed his 10th standard at a local school in his hometown. That same year, a medical consultation at Sankara Nethralaya, Chennai, revealed that he had Retinitis Pigmentosa (RP), in both eyes. Following this, Farhan was referred to the Vision Enhancement Clinic (VEC) at the Vision-Aid Resource Center for rehabilitation and educational guidance.

Vision-Aid’s collaboration with Christian Medical College (CMC), Vellore

Vision-Aid has partnered with Christian Medical College, Vellore, to establish a Vision Rehabilitation Resource Center within the CMC campus. This collaboration builds on CMC’s long-standing rehabilitation philosophy and Vision-Aid’s expertise in comprehensive vision rehabilitation, with the shared goal of expanding access to high-quality services for persons with visual impairments.

Vision-Aid Celebrates the First Batch of BPO Training Placements at Chennai

Vision-Aid has successfully completed the first batch of BPO training course at the Advanced Training Center in Chennai. The program, launched in February 2025, was designed to empower visually impaired students with computer, communication, and professional skills to help them find meaningful employment. We are proud to introduce our first batch of candidates, who have now secured jobs in reputed organizations with Vision-Aid’s support.

Continue Reading

From Challenges to Tech Success: Mohan Raj’s Journey with Vision-Aid

Mohan hails from Salem, Tamil Nadu. Born with only 40% vision, he faced significant challenges in his early education. Despite these obstacles, he completed his schooling in a mainstream school in 2013. Reading from the blackboard and printed books was particularly difficult for him, but with the support of his friends and teachers—who helped him with notes—Mohan persevered and continued his studies.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Celebrates the Successful Completion of Its 10th Batch of Digital Accessibility Testing Training

Vision-Aid, with the valued support of BarrierBreak, proudly announces the successful completion of its 10th batch of the Digital Accessibility Testing (DAT) Training Program. We sincerely thank BarrierBreak for their unwavering partnership in empowering our students and enabling this milestone. The batch commenced in March 2025 and concluded in July 2025, with 21 students graduating from the program.

Continue Reading

A Visionary Beyond Sight: The Inspiring Journey of Vedant Mundada

Vedant Mundada’s journey is not just about facing life’s challenges. It is about turning them into purpose. When he lost his eyesight at just one and a half years old due to optic nerve damage, many would expect limitations to follow. But Vedant’s life tells a different story — one filled with courage, growth, and inspiration.

Continue Reading

Vision-Aid Announces its New Leadership Team for 2025-26

LEXINGTON, MA – Vision-Aid, a non-profit organization serving the visually impaired, announced several notable additions to its leadership team for 2025-26. This year’s 100% volunteer Vision-Aid Leadership team includes its 15-member Board of Directors (BOD), 15-member Board of Advisors (BOA), and 5-member Council of Ambassadors (COA).

Continue Reading

Empowering Futures: Vision-Aid’s Support Leads Jagriti SDC Students to 100% Success in HSC Board Exams

Since 2022, Vision-Aid has been a dedicated partner to Jagriti Skill Development Center (SDC), offering transformative training programs such as communication skills, computer literacy, and personality development to visually impaired students. Today, we are proud to celebrate a remarkable milestone: all 12 students from Jagriti SDC who appeared for the HSC Board Exams (FY2025) have successfully passed — marking the 4th consecutive year of 100% results for the center.

Continue Reading

In the last quarter, our Vision-Aid Resource Centers throughout India have been dedicated to supporting the visually impaired community. Journey of Resilience and Empowerment: Mohan Ram’s Story

My name is Mohan Ram, and I hail from Bengaluru, Karnataka. After completing my schooling in 2006, I pursued a Diploma in Electronics & Communication. However, I soon began facing difficulties with practical lab work, assignments, and a noticeable deterioration in my night vision. A visit to the ophthalmologist confirmed the diagnosis: Retinitis Pigmentosa, a progressive eye disorder that leads to gradual vision loss.
